Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in fantastic location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: aziz_hamdan
Reviews.Content: The hotel isnt big but its decent and does the job. The rooms are a very good siZe for europe so u wont feel trapped. The location is fantastic, ur just 1 leep away from the champ elyess. You. An walk to all the other areas like saint german, fab henray... Ect. Or take subway. Ext door. There is also a supmarket just on side for water and late night snacks. Best of all the staff r super frendly and hard working. They make things happen for u in paris. I highly recomend this property.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: elenaweng
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just opposite the Champs Elysee, perfect location to visit Paris. The staff is very kind, they try to help you with any request and gave us great advise about place to visit and restaurant where to eat. We will definitely go back when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: SouthCalgirl
Reviews.Content: The room we had was tiny. It was showing its wear. The shower attachment in the shower was coming out of the wall. There was some mold on the floor of the bathroom by the shower. The desk staff was friendly and helpful. The posted prices start at 800 Euros, definately not worth the price for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff & service but not a 4* room”
Reviews.Author: becca_stu
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband for a weekend using our points to pay for the room, and was pleased I wasn't paying as we would have complained. -The shower kept going hot & cold while you stand under it. -The sink was filthy, but that was because of the design, not the cleaners. -The TV kept turning itself off. -The fridge was not cold. -The seats are ridiculous, the cushions would slip off unless you sit very still. We couldn't fault the staff or the service though so these things didn't really affect our stay as we were out of the room most of the time. But, as I said, I would'nt have paid the 550euro tariff (there was a sign on the back of the door) without complaining!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay in Paris this year - still looking for a good 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Croxford64
Reviews.Content: I was back in Paris for work after being there for pleasure in August. That time I stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe and wrote that it was disappointing for the price(I had used points but the posted rate was outrageous). This time at the Radisson Blu, the location was similar but the experience was worse: crappy wood floors, worse bathroom, cold shower, somewhat unpleasant staff, elevator didn't work at times. Therefore if I had a choice, I would take the Hilton, but at the end of the day it's all about price. We used to stay at a former Sofitel in the area which was great. It's now part of a boutique chain, but it's worth looking up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, faulty aircon, fair price”
Reviews.Author: kowkowzeiss
Reviews.Content: Booked for business by company. Great location for conference. Walked everyday to Palais des congress. Front facing room so view of Arc de Triomphe. Really just a small business hotel but run by international management company. No fuss. Clean, reasonably quiet double glazed windows to the front, wifi included (I think). Only issue was aircon faulty on first day (reported previously by other members). For business, for the price, it's quite reasonable and I'd stay there for the location. Not for leisure as very bland hotel otherwise. Staffs were genuine and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expect from Radisson (despite expensive breakfasts!)”
Reviews.Author: Tabascoleathergrain
Reviews.Content: I have regularly stayed at Radisson hotels throughout the world and have rarely been disappointed. The Champs Elysees version maintained that success rate and my wife and I found all of the staff very willing to help, courteous and able to communicate effectively despite our basic French - indeed, without exception the individuals at the front-of-house spoke excellent English. We had a double room on the 7th floor with a balcony from which we almost overlooked the Arc de Triomphe some 100 yards or so away while the Eiffel Tower was also visible above the roofops of the buildings opposite. Inside the room was a desk/chair plus an armchair and table while there were ample space and hangers inside the wardrobes for clothes. The TV showed a variety of French channels plus the usual additions such as CNN, BBC World and an assortment of other foreign stations with a range of pay-per-view films also available. There were no tea-making facilities within the room. My only slight reservation was the cost of breakfast ranging from 24-29 euros per person ("Continental" and "English" being at the respective extremes) although I must admit that the fare on offer was excellent. For those not wishing to spend as much, or looking for a smaller snack there are many nearby cafes offering simple breakfast for 6-14 euros. Etoile RER/Metro is about 200 yards away so the rest of Paris is easily accessible if an alternative to walking is required.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Pap
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Only a glance away from the arc de triumph. Greeting could have been better upon arrival but a good stay in all. A bit over priced for what it is, but would stay again for the ease of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Leonor S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Radisson Blu Champs-Elisée for four nights for the European Congress of Cardiology.(The congress was at Parc des Exposition, a 40 minutes trip from L' Etoile.RER A until Chatelet and then RER B).The front desk staff was very nice. They don't have buffet breakfast and the staff to serve was not well prepared to serve so many breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny clean room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Baltan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the single room for one night for business. The room was tiny and clean. Enough for business traveler. The most impressive things was I could see the part of l'Arc de Triomphe from the room! What a nice location. I ate breakfast and felt a bit frustrating, because they had only one staff to serve more than six groups and I was kept waiting.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Greg_TorontoCA
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at the Radisson-Blu Champs-Elysees was amazing! The front desk staff was very helpful and provided us with great suggestions for dinners. They also helped us out with the car we rented and gave us simple directions to drive out of the city. We stayed in Room 702... The view was FANTASTIC and probably the best room in the house. We really enjoyed! Thanks to Nadia and the Concierge staff for all their assistance!

Reviews.Title: “We also come back to the lovely Radisson Blue”
Reviews.Author: Marwa_M
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i were on a trip to Paris in June 2011. It was the first time we leave our one-year old child back home with my parents. Hence, we wanted a nice relaxing break. Unfortunatley, we initally booked at a different hotel and didnt like. Since we had earlier stayed at the Radisson Blue, we decided to go back there again. And yes it was worth it. From the clean towels, spacious bathroom, clean bedroom and amenities. It was an experience well worth it. Of course, the concierge staff were extremley helpful as usual in arranging trip and making the necessary bookings. Thank you Radisson Blu.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Qwerty62
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Everything just right. Front desk staff were particularly helpful, bellman too.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service and bad management”
Reviews.Author: zen79
Reviews.Content: WE stayed there for 4 nights .. on the first night there was no aircondition and the room was offered to us well knowing that the ac was not working .A responsible hotel should inform the guest at the time of check in if this situation prevails. we demanded on the first day that incase the ac cannot be repaired and they cannot offer another room in the hotel they should accomodate us at their own cost in another similar radisson hotel for which we were denied that each hotel is managed individually and has a different management. anyhow we were made to compromise with a promise that the second day the aircondition would start working. but much to our shock even the second day ac was not repaired .we protested to such bad service and upon much protest they finally changed our room to 5th floor at night...and we had to take the pains of packing and unpacking again ...which is the last thing a guest wants to do in a holiday where they come to relax and de-stress.to add to the nuisance the 3rd day the 5th floor ac where we shifted the night before also stopped.when we approached the reception they said we donnot know when it will start working and if it will start working or not.further they said that they are very busy and donnot have time to attend .the staff wasmost uncourteous even in this situation when they could not deliver the service to their guest for which they charge.over and above this on the 3rd day the staff in a very uncoutesous manner told us that incase we donnot wish to stay we could check out, well knowing that we were carrying a paid booking.we questioned then that are they getting us accomodated in the hotel for which they said ''no'' .to add to it ,it were busy days in paris when all the rates were at its peak . this was a height of harasment and our holiday was spoiled due to the hotel. i would not suggest this hotel to anybody as they are not responsible at all to their guests and donnot deliver what they promise ''100% customer satisfaction' .....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: findgregg
Reviews.Content: We travel the World and can give you a pretty accurate review of this hotel. It is exactly what you pay for. Perfect for a short stay and a perfect starter hotel for if you are new to Paris. Small, nice and comfortable room. The location is perfect access to all of Paris. The staff is so nice and helpful (and we are American). Everyone was so helpful and they really go out of the way to make you comfortable. There is a restaurant that look nice but we did not have a chance to try it since we were only there for 3 nights. You are on the Champs Eylesee and a few hundred yards from the Arc. There are shops and cafes everywhere you look. Walking distance to the Lourve, Eiffel Tower, and all the other sights. I recommend the hotel. I wish I could remember the name of the guy who helped us out, he was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: anniesusan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful. Small room, but had everything we needed. Location was very good. Service was ok. Expect Rude French service in the dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: nandoscala
Reviews.Content: As a global traveler, I can be very straight in saying that Radisson Blue Champs Elysées stands out for quality and home feeling. Quality of the hotel in all its assets (position near to the Arc de Triomphe, proximity to Metro and shopping, good restaurants very near) stands out, but what is more remarkable is the kindness of staff. I had a little, but potentially serious, emergency to solve last time I was there, and I can say that staff put everything they had to my disposition in order to help me. It is very difficult I choose another hotel when going in Paris...

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MarcosFaco
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the heart of Paris, this is the Hotel to stay. You are very near to Champs Elysees, where you can find everything. The Hotel is very clean and the service is very good. The only thing that is not very good is the room. They are not big enough, but that is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff, would go again.”
Reviews.Author: traindriver240
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of times for long weekends and loved it both times. We have always had a deluxe room overlooking avenue marceau with views of the Arc De Triumph (200m away) and the eiffel tower (a ten minute walk). Even though the road is fairly busy we have never been disturbed and always slept very well. Never eaten here apart from breakfast which is nice and freshly prepared but expensive. Even though we had the car with us each time we left it in the underground secure garage (right outside and about 30 euros a night) and walked everywhere. All the main sights like the Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame are easily done on foot. The rooms are bright, modern and a decent size but this year we felt it was looking a bit tired. Staff are friendly and helpful - a lot better than we would expect in a capital city. If you want a romantic break this place is superb. Highly recommended. We are going again for next years valentines.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: sanperez
Reviews.Content: You can't get much better than this in terms on location without paying much more in Paris. The hotel is on Avenue Marceau steps away from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs. Elysėes. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome, unlike any stereotype of Paris service. The air conditioning system was broken but I must say that the weather was so nice that we never needed it. My room had large windows that opened to a charming street (see picture). The hotel also compensated for this by including breakfast and sodas frm the mini bar for free. The rooms are comfortable, modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and phenomenal staff”
Reviews.Author: pradamommy
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this location...and the staff has got to be the nicest staff I have ever met. They go out of their way and are always very nice. The hotel had air conditioning problems but we were lucky to be in the rooms that had the AC.otherwise with asthma,i wouldn't have been able to stay there. Housekeeping was the best I have ever seen although they DO enter the room when u have a do not disturb sign up....but they are very thorough and nice Make sure u go to Laduree on the Champs Elysee for dessert .....it's amazing...!

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of paris.”
Reviews.Author: ebbearda
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the most amazing location. we were lucky enough to have a room on the top floor with a large balcony.we could almost reach out and touch the arche de triomphe.it is in the pefect place for sight seeing. the rooms are small but perfectly formed, with beautiful bathrooms and huge showers. We had breakfast served on the balcony each morning by the breath taking view. this truelyis a wonderful hotel, the only down side is that it is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: inikamozi
Reviews.Content: I stay in many Radisson hotels for business so the experience can be somewhat numbing. This is the first time I have stayed in a Radisson for pleasure and I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean, well cared for and had a truely boutique feel. It was centrally located, by the Arc de Triomphe, but very quiet and a few minutes from the Metro. The one thing that really made our stay here such a pleasant experience was the staff. Everyone was really helpful, friendly effficient. Whilst it can be a bit of a hit and miss experience trying to find a reasonable hotel in Paris at a

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit tiny, but does the job”
Reviews.Author: HAMH80
Reviews.Content: I had a suite, with a huge private balcony, so my son had a good time, running around and playing, i enjoyed the free wifi in the balcony. Great hotel really, staff are kind, and were able to solve some issues even after mid-night. the suite is a bit tiny, but clean, and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Small but beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: catoha
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights at this hotel and was very satisfied. The rooms where very nice with a beautiful batchroom and a large flat screen TV. The breakfast is not included, but there is a very nice restaurant on the ground floor. For breakfast this food was to sweat for my taste, so we eat breakfast out the other days. The location of the hotel is perfect. You can walk to about anywhere in the city or use the subway. The nearest station is just minutes away. The hotel is perfect for a romantic weekend. Maybe even get a room with a view? We didn't.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: margaretNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend from the 23rd to 26th June. I spent a long time researching hotels ( being a travel agent) before choosing the Radisson Blu mainly for the location but also not being a fan of big hotels because it seemed a contemporary boutique option. On the plus side the staff were friendly and good all the way from reservations to check in etc. The public areas including the bar and small restaurant and terrace were well presented. The main problem was that in the room we were given although not a bad size for the cente of Paris the furnishings were well worn and very shabby including the bathroom. I have to say I was very disappointed as I felt it was more something you would find in a not very good 3 star. It is well overdue a refurbishment and for that reason only feel I could not recommend it to any of my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for sightseeing in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: AngelUrbano
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend at the Radisson Champs Elysees, what a great hotel - its just one street away from the Champs Elysees and about 3 streets from the Air France bus which takes you to and from Terminal 2 at Charles de Gaulle Airport (there is one for Orly as well) The hotel is a small boutique hotel with only 40 or so rooms, the rooms are on the small side, but this doesnt really matter as we certainly didnt spend much time in ours! The room was clean and contained everything we needed for a weekend break. The bed was very comfortable as well! When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by reception who swiftly checked us in, a concierge took our bags and they magically were already in our room when we got there! The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a small bar area, dining room and outside patio (our room overlooked this - it was never noisy and quite pretty to look at). We never used any of these facilities but they looked good. Hotel is handy to walk to the Bateaux Mouche Tours and the Eiffel tour, as well the Arc de Triomphe and Le Lourve etc. We walked everywhere. Lots of places to eat and drink nearby if you arent wanting to brave any other areas! There is a public Drugstore a few doors up from the hotel which contains lots of 'shop's - a deli/bakery, off license, a Pierre Herme Concession, baby clothes, Pharmacy, designer bags, cigars, newsagents and a cocktail bar/restaurant! This hotel full price is quite expensive, we paid for it on my husbands goldpoints, but I would recommend staying here if you are prepared to pay the price or if you get a deal on it. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: dk011
Reviews.Content: We had two nights here in early May. While the location is excellent and the hotel clean there are quite a few downsides for the price. Our room was small even by Paris standards and the bed was uncomfortable. Service in the bar was slower than you would expect and the cost of breakfast was exceesive - €22 for a continental. You could have a 'quick' continental, which they will only serve in the bar, but this was €11 for a croissant (no butter or jam) and a coffee. Average prices are around €260 for a room but the value was more like €160. You are paying for location.

Reviews.Title: “I miss a buffet breakfast - otherwise an OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Statstjenestemannen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson blu for five days during a business trip to Paris. The hotel was OK - the rooms were modern but a bit to dark in my opinion - and the reception and other areas of the hotel seemed to be well maintained. The hotel was a bit pricy - as are all hotels in Paris - but the service from the staff was impeccable. The only thing I really missed in this hotel, was a proper breakfast. You have to order (overpriced) breakfast from a menu, it had been far better if the hotel had arranged a normal buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Magda70
Reviews.Content: It wasn't bad but it wasn't very good. We stayed for 3 nights and it was quite pricy as we booked the top floor "suite" which consisted of a small sitting area, a separate toilet, a smallish bedroom, a bathroom with a whirlpool bath and shower and a patio area. I didn't see a normal room so my review has to be restricted to this one. Most of my comments are based on the high price we paid - normal rooms may be much cheaper and better value. The layout of the room was good for us as our son could sleep in the sitting area. It was just that the whole room had seen better days. It wasn't dirty but it was scuffed and old fashioned - the floor had scuff marks where the bed is pulled in and out, the grout in the bathroom was not very white, there were scale marks in the granite sinks where water dripped (which could be cleaned if someone tried). The patio was nice but you didn't get a view - it was surrounded by plants. You could just see the Arc de Triomphe if you stood on a chair (a bit like the Fawlty Towers sea view). It also had rickety boarding that needed maintenance. The bed was comfy but you do get vibrations from the nearby extractor which shake the bed and don't aid sleep. There were dark fitted wardrobes and I found you couldn't see into them as when the doors opened they shut out the natural light and there was no lighting nearby. I actually felt quite claustrophobic at times in the room - not something I''ve experienced before. The bathroom toiletries were not very good - a mixed bunch and oddly no hair conditioner which threw me a bit. I didn't take any of them home with me (which I usually do) and they were not replenished during our stay. As part of the room deal we got a bottle of cheap champagne - presented in an ice bucket on the first night and then just left in the melted water for the next two nights when we didn't drink it. They didn't seem to think fresh ice may have inspired us to drink it! Breakfast was quite nice - the smallest "full English" cooked breakfast I've ever seen which didn't worry us as we had pastries but may do someone else. Depending where you sat the breakfast room veered into reception one end and a conference room the other and I felt a little "on display" at times. Service was a bit slow in general. It was a fairly good location for the metro but not the best area for eating or even shopping. I would certainly not stay here again as there are much nicer areas and much nicer hotels about - that said we did have a lovely trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but not sure if it's worth it”
Reviews.Author: Schroedinger
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Radisson Champs Elysees. The hotel is very nice, great rooms, spacious, elegant, etc. However, it's very expensive, we paid using my Radisson points but I think I would never have gone there paying by cash. Unfortunately, breakfast was not included in my stay (we discovered this upon departure), and it was hideously expensive. 24 EUR for a pretty basic breakfast is way too much, even for Paris. I'm sure it's possible to find a decent breakfast nearby at half that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly service”
Reviews.Author: M0rgan77
Reviews.Content: had a late arrival after a business trip but the staff was very helpful. Excellent service, clean and spacy room on the quite site. Good quality bed. Bathroom was clean but the sink not realy functional for a hotel of this standard (design doesn't mean userfriendly). Plenty of restaurants in the area and central location for my next customer meeting. Recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Marwa_M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in Oct '09. It happens to be the old HQ office of Louis Vuitton. Here is our take: Pros 1- Location is absolutely superb. It overlooks the Arc D'Trumph, though our room did not. It is 3 mins walking distance away from the bus station and Charles De Gaulle Etoille station on the Champs ELysee. You have a coffee shop next to you and a pharmacy/mini supermarket for late night emergencies. Of course you also have full access to the luxury world of Champs Elysee. 2- The staff were amazing, couldn't complain. They helped us in everything from A to Z and made our stay extra comfortable; from booking reservations at shows to providing us with guidance and directions on restaurants and shopping. 3- the hotel is very clean, and the housekeeping are very efficient. The furniture is very trendy. Cons 1- Slightly on the expensive side, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “The staff exceeded our expectations in making our stay pleasureable”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeV10
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a smile when we arrived very early (7 am) on a Saturday morning and our room was waiting for us. Throughout our stay suggestions were made for great local restaurants, sightseeing and tours. The staff was always courteous and helpful. In particular, I would like to thank our friendly concierge and Gisela for all of the help and advise. The hotel was a 5 minute walk to the Metro. Well maintained and very clean. Hopefully, next time we will be able to take advantage of the pool. The room was on par with other European hotels that we have stayed in. However, the bathroom was much larger than expected and the shower, equipted with a rain shower, was great especially after a full day of touring.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel great location and views”
Reviews.Author: sottilared
Reviews.Content: a wonderful hotel, we found it very convient to all locations we were visiting. Though one note, if you are there on a holiday weekend the restaurant will probably be closed, this happend to us as it was the easter holiday weekend. So it was close from friday-monday the entire time we were there, so we didn't get to enjoy it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sketchdnky
Reviews.Content: My wife spent two nights at this wonderful hotel. It is located 1 block from the Metro station, and is one block from the Champs Elysees. Everything one could want is nearby. Great shopping, great food, great people watching! The hotel can be termed a business hotel, but my wife and I found it wonderful. The staff was great. The front desk staff assisted us with great dinner suggestions, booked us show times at Moulan Rouge, and answered all of my tourist questions as if they truely cared about our expierence outside of thier hotel just as much as our expierence at thier hotel. The lobby has free internet access at a stationary laptop, a great bar, and a resturaunt (never ate, but the food looked good!). The room was very large for Paris standards. A large bathroom with tub/shower, and a beautiful designed bedroom. Flatscreen tv and nice artwork on the walls. We loved our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb staff, dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Czechgenes
Reviews.Content: I spent four (4) days at the Radisson Champs Elysees in mid June 2009. I booked a room for 247 Euros/night without breakfast. When I arrived at the hotel I was upgraded to room 407 which is located at the back of the hotel. The room was fairly large compared to the typical Paris hotel room. The room had two French doors that opened and allowed a breeze to circulate throughout the room, although the room was air-conditioned. The room was clean, functional, but dated. The staff was very accomodating, friendly and efficient. I was told by many locals, including hotel staff members, that the Ave. Des Champs Ellysees had turned into an overpriced shopping mall and to shop and eat away from the Champs. I found this advice to be true. The hotel is one block from the Metro station at the Arc Triomphe. I took the Eurostar from London which terminates at the Gare du Nord. The Metro cost me $2.20 USD to get to the hotel versus around $80 USD by cab. If you have a lot of luggage or are disabled the Metro is not the best option because the number of stairs one needs to climb to negotiate through the Metro's innards before arriving at the hotel. The Eiffel Tower is about a 20-25 minute walk from the hotel and there are a number of restaurants in the area within walking distance. Many of the surrounding streets are in upscale neighborhoods and I encountered no problems during my stay. My advice to management is to update the bathrooms and replace the dated furniture. The hotel offers free internet use of a laptop computer cabled to the wall in the small lounge area next the the hotel bar. Yes, the older laptop is cabled to the wall and poorly lit. I had to retrive a flashlight from my luggage in order to illuminate the keyboard. The hotel restaurant was empty most nights, consequently I never dined there. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and appreciated the staff's friendly, helpful service. If you are looking for a quaint neighborhood to enjoy a few days in Paris or a newer, trendy hotel you might look elsewhere. If you need to be near the Champs for business or shopping the Radisson offers a good location and a helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: wj16
Reviews.Content: Traveling a lot for business, it was a pleasure staying in this hotel. The hotel is clean and modern ( huge TV), the staff is very helpfull and the location is top

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonFranky
Reviews.Content: After three night in this hotel, i can say that I had a very nice stay. The hotel is very clean and beautiful but the best is the sevrice you can expect from this boutique hotel. I f like me know you do not know much about Paris, the staff is there to recommend anything you need to make a graeat week-end, thanks to all

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: a_r_szabo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights at the Radisson SAS Hotel Champs Elysees. We arrived at the hotel at around 10.30am and had the pleasant surprise that the room was ready. The hotel is very close to the Arc de Triomphe, which we could see from our room window. It is also close to the famous Champs-Elysées. The rooms are relatively small (remember that it is the same for most central Paris hotels), but modern and well furnished. We did not have breakfast in the hotel since it was too expensive. Hard to say if the hotel is good value for money - in that price range there is a lot of choice. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and can only recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: didineLondon
Reviews.Content: I have spent a week-end in Paris and I wanted to say how much I enjoyed the hotel. It was well located, the staff was so friendly and the hotel is very modern. I recommend you this hotel if you are looking to treat yourself in Paris

Reviews.Title: “A lucky find”
Reviews.Author: jorgins
Reviews.Content: We originally checked into the Marriot on Champs Elysee and after one night moved to this hotel. The staff were great, the room airy and comfortable. Our room had a balconmy that looked at the Arc d'Triomphe. The restaurant was an Oasis with excleent food and wines. Easy to get the the Charles de Gaulle - Étoile Metro Station. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and efficient staff,but you can do a lot better for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Vegasvet
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 nights stay in this hotel and we were both satisfied with our choice. Staff was very attentive and polite,even when I've called back from home because I had some forgotten items,they were quick and accomodating about the matter. Location is great,close to the RER and Metro' wich we never actually use except on arrival and departure. We usually stay in the Champs Elysee area beacuse we like to walk around. The only criticism I have goes to the rooms. They feel a bit cramped,with an enormous bathroom and a smallish bedroom. Add to that the small mattress,wich on their website is sold as a king size one but it is really a queen one. Comfy one anyway. And at a special rate of Euro 225.00 per night,I you can do a lott better in town,trust me. The right nightly rate for this hotel,considering location and the Paris hype should be no more than 190.00 Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Fastastic Service!! Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Violator00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Champs Elysees for 4 Nights during the last days of 2008 and New Years Eve and had a real terrific experience. Let's start with the location. 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel tower, 15 minutes walk from the Opera house, and one minute only away from the Arc and Champ Elysees. we were literally in the center of all action, good restaurants and all trendy places are all over. The room was very clean, bit smaller than i expected for a Business Class room but still relatively good enough in French standards. We had a slight problem with the bed. we had 2 single mattresses combined and often had to push these from both directions to prevent the gap. i find it a bit uncomfortable to sleep like that if you are a couple who like cuddling at night ;) The service was absolutely amazing. I have never seen such friendly receptionists and a cool concierge who gave us all the tips and information we needed to hang out in the city. All guys at the reception always were willing to help and way much more professional and enthusiast than any other hotel i ever stayed before. I would recommend this hotel to anybody i know just because of that service.. that was a good surprise indeed! The breakfast service was really kind and sweet, but i found it strange to had it served to my table and not pick all my favorites up from a buffet. I find the breakfast slightly smaller than i expected. but not a bad one. Furthermore, the hotel didn't rip me off for extras just like all the others in Europe i've been staying so far. WIFI was for free, a very fast connection too and never had a problem to connect at anytime. very strong signal as well. The only negative thing i can say is that Business Class room is not a real upgrade. i find it more like a brandable way to charge more money. The specification of Biz Room in their website suggests "late checkout" while we didn't manage to get that in practice. Plus the view was not the best, while i expected a business class room to have a better one. but bottom line, their service compensated for it all.. we were just astonished to see their enthusiasm to make us happy all the time. Paris was beautiful, we really enjoyed ourselves. even though Champ Elysees is no more a luxurious street but a hangout for all scary gangs in town.. especially on New Years Eve, that was scary indeed :)

Reviews.Title: “A Superb 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithSuying
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel along the Champs Elysees is definitely a superb hotel without doubt! It's exactly the kind of hotel that we are all yearning for: 1) Soft sparkling clean bed 2) All bedroom facilities maintained at top conditions it almost looked new 3) A door partition between the bathroom and the bedroom so any "business" you make won't affect the fragrance of your bedroom 4) Clean and dust free furnitures 5) Air conditioning even in winter times so you do not have to open the windows and expose yourself to the dust and dry air. 5) Bathroom is sparkling clean without any stains 6) Bathroom comes with a speaker so you can listen to the tv news while you are bathing 7) A good coffee maker 8) Good selection of tv programs 10) Prompt room service 9) Fantastic concierge services 10) Staffs who LISTENS to your request and satisfies them 11) Situated along the glamourous shopping malls 12) Situated near the historical icon Arc De Tromphe 13) Situated near the train station During my short 2 nights stopover in Paris, I had actually booked for another hotel near champs elysees on the internet and it had explicitly deceived me into believing that all their hotel rooms had air conditioning during winter times. Although i understand that it is usually the culture that hotels will not provide air conditioning during winter season, I needed air conditioning as I could not be exposed to winter air for a long period due to very dry skin conditions. Hence, I booked for the hotel believing their advert that they have air conditioning even in winter times. However, when i reached the hotel everything was a scam. 1) The hotel room was so small i had difficulty opening the wardrobe door. 2) The bedsheets were filled with dust. 3) One smack on the pillows will set the dust flying over your face! Horrible. 4) Air conditioning worked on a central control system, hence there was no way I could request for air conditioning for my room. 5) The safebox was spoilt. Needless to say, I made a complaint to the frontdesk. Only to see that they were rude and adamant about their services and the wrongly advertised information. Not wanting it to dampen my holiday mood, i went out of the hotel in search of a better hotel and that was where i stumbled up the concierge staff Radisson Hotel! Everything took a drastic change from here. The concierge was highly professional who spoke with grace, enthusiasm and politeness. Immediately they showed me to the room which is available for our consideration and offered to transfer our luggages from the nasty hotel to theirs! Their service was professional and efficient. Hence without further ado I went back to the hotel, spoke with the manager about my situation, waived the penalty payment of cancellation of hotel booking fees and dived straight into the cozy arms of Radisson! Don't despise this seemingly small hotel of Radisson, you will feel immediate elegance and professionalism of their hotel staffs right at their door step. Rest assured for a memorable holiday. A place not to be missed. Enjoy! Suying

Reviews.Title: “Expect a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Mangia-mangia
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves a high(er) ranking in the Paris hotels scale. Given the ability to spend a seriously high amount of money here, the Radisson does an excellent job at very reasonable prices. Location, staff, breakfast and rooms are all superior quality, and you will not leave disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique business hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: quirky76
Reviews.Content: Beautifully situated boutique business hotel, providing excellent clean rooms with free WIFI and INternet. The resturant is rather special with a great long term chef who prepares food with a special attention to details due to the boutique nature of the hotel the service is warm, friendly and personal Well done raddisson

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: sm2008
Reviews.Content: I spend a two night in this hotel, it was very pleasant, well located , clean, and with a very good service

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: evo1125
Reviews.Content: I just spend a two days in this property and it has been the best stay ever. The hotel is modern, clean, well located but the best is the staff. They are all very pleasant and dedicated to assist you. I do recommend this hotel to anyone. thanks to all of them for this fabulous stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good but it's just "Mordern",,,, that's it”
Reviews.Author: erinae
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. It was a week ago... When I checked in, the TV screen was not so clear and few minutes later, I did NOT watch anything on the screen and I needed to change the room from 7th foor to 3rd floor without balcony. The hotel was nothing to do me in spite of chaning my room when I was so tired. Totally, it was clean, quite area but that's it. Just 'Mordern' hotel. It will be my last visit for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: alimor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rasisson SAS Hotel, Champs Elysee over Valentine's weekend an we had a fantastic time. For us, the Hotel was ideally located just a few yeards from the Arc de Triomphe and one street away from the Champs Elysee. It was almost like a launch pad, we could get pretty much anywhere in Paris, very easily, while if we just wanted to stay locally there was plenty to do. The Hotel itself was very cleverly renovated (from the old Louis Vuitton HQ) and is very contemporary. The room was pretty standard size for a City Centre hotel, en suite bathroom with high spec fixtures and fittings. Room service breakfast was very efficient for saving time in the morning, the staff were VERY helpful. We booked a balcony room, with a view and the view really was as it looked on the website - brilliant! The lobby bar wasn't very well stocked, but really that can be our only down comment. I'd highly recommend this Hotel and will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson SAS is swell”
Reviews.Author: CraigJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 6 nights, beginning of November 07 - our 2nd visit - overall a very good experience - hotel is small (around 50 rooms) so the service is personal - staff was friendly and very professional - room well appointed with separate tub and shower in bath, modern design, decent linens etc - the room was showing a bit of wear since our last visit in Mar 2006 - location is very good as just off the Champs Elysees and very close to a major metro stop - we used the metro every day - was extremely convenient - I'd stay here again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: kq501
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location... right next to the Arc De T and all those great shops and cafes. Paris is everything you've probably ever heard about it. Myself and my partner had a fantastic time. The hotel was spotless, and very modern. Rooms are slightly smaller than they look on the website, but I think most hotel rooms in Paris are probably the same. The area is fantastic, very quiet at night. We decided against eating in the hotel as there are so many wonderful cafes to get breakfast, lunch or dinner throughout Paris. The cafe at George V is wonderful. Great desserts!!! The staff are very friendly... and excellent at dining recommendations. The downstairs in the hotel is a little lifeless though... perhaps it's the time we went, but mainly consisted of business men looking very depressed over there bourbon on ice. All in all I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, if only for it's great location.

Reviews.Title: “An above average experience”
Reviews.Author: OCmomOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews from other trip advisor comments and was not disappointed. The hotel was lovely. It was small and charming, warm and inviting. We arrived early in the morning and we were allowed to check into our room a couple of hours prior to standard check-in time. Everyone spoke English excellently and everyone was very friendly. Our room was small but big enough for my husband & I plus it was very quiet. I did not hear anything from outside our room so sleeping well was not an issue. We had the best breakfasts at the hotel though we tired a couple other places. I would recommend this hotel to others. It certainly helped make our visit to Paris more pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: SunshineScoop
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is in the perfect place to explore Paris. I could see the Arc de Triumphe from my little balcony. Breakfast served by the wait staff was rather better than the usual buffet. (Nice outside area for warmer days) Room was well set up with a spacious bathroom. (Almost an oriental minimalist ambiance) Most of the reception/concierge were very helpful. My only negative was smoking in the cafe/bar. One evening I went back with friends to the bar only to find this frenchman puffing away on a Gaulois!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cory1976
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a great location in Paris. Our room was a good size (for Europe) and was decked out in an ultra modern fashion. Dark wood floors and walls gave you a cozy feel. Bathrooms are gorgeous. We stayed in room 501 which has a balcony. We got pictures of the Arc right from it! In house resturaunt is pricy but great for dinner. I recommend going to the "drugstore" nearby where you can get a real Parisian breakfast like fresh bread, fruit, juice and yogurt for really cheap. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Well-run and reliable little place”
Reviews.Author: Traipsers
Reviews.Content: We had no expectations of this hotel before arriving, as we had originally planned to stay at the K&K Hotel Cayre in the 6th. Unfortunately, the K&K's air conditioning was not working well, and it was 90 degrees the day we arrived. So we ended up moving to the Radisson, and the staff was very friendly and understanding of our situation. They didn't try to gouge us just because they sensed how desperate we were to find other accommodations. They set us up in a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and the Arc--granted, we could only see the top of the tower, and the arc was visible only if we stuck our heads out our window and looked to the right. But it was still pretty nice. The room--relatively small, but not uncomfortably so, and certainly not unusually small by Paris standards. Also, there was a nice-sized hallway in the room that made it feel more spacious, and a huge full-sized mirror. And we had a terrace with typical large French windows. Yes, the terrace was small and really only big enough to stand in, but the mere fact that it was there made the room feel bigger. The room was always spotless, and turndown service was consistent and on time. The air conditioning was wonderful and individually controlled. TV worked fine, good amount of closet space, and lots of shelves to store your belongings. The bathroom--very cute, and very clean, except for one or two tiny patches of mildew in the shower tile. Otherwise, I only had two minor complaints about the bathroom. First, the sink drain was very, very slow. The sink was also very shallow and did not have a run-off drain, so, basically, in order to avoid overflow, you had to keep the water going at only a trickle. If you let it flow full blast, you basically ended up with a full sink within seconds. Second, the shower door was only about a foot wide, and leaked like crazy. We put three towels down on the floor to absorb the water, but after every shower, the towels and the floor were soaking wet. I mentioned these issues to the front desk. They were very smiling and understood the problems, but said that was just the way the bathrooms were designed. Slightly annoying, but not a huge deal. The service--I found the front desk staff very friendly and eager to please. They did not seem super-knowledgeable about restaurant recommendations and the like, so I wouldn't rely on them for that kind of information. What they are helpful with are calling places for you, lending umbrellas, etc. They always said good morning and good night with a smile, which was nice. The location--super-touristy and super-expensive, with a sprinkling of office buildings and car dealerships. (Mind you, these are Parisian office buildings and car dealerships, which are not ugly eye sores at all; it just means the neighborhood can be pretty dead in spots, especially during the summer.) The outdoor cafes on the Champs Elysees, which are right around the corner from the hotel, are overpriced and mediocre. That said, the hotel is in easy walking distance of just about everything in central Paris. The nearest taxi stand is 2 blocks away, and you can get just about anywhere in 10 minutes. Even Sacre Coeur is only a 15-minute cab ride away. Another convenience: there is an amazing drugstore/gift shop around the corner called Publicis Drugstore. It's pricey, but is great for "supplies" like bottled water, batteries, toiletries, newspapers, etc., as well as fun non-essentials like purses, cashmere sweaters, and just about anything else you can think of. Overall, the area felt very safe. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to friends. It's not particularly charming or special or glamorous, but it's clean, spotless, friendly, and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: knitski
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place with a great location. Clean and bright with very helpful staff. Absolutely no complaints. Breakfast selection was limited, but the convenience and service was great. Highly recommended. Great convenience store next door for picking up lunch or snacks.....we ended up spending $ there every day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NomadPrincess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently returned from a long weekend at this hotel and were really pleased that we chose to go here. The hotel is conveniently located, just a couple of minutes walk from the Charles de Gaule Etoile Metro station and right next to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. We decided to go for the 'Room with a View' package and got a good view of the Arc de Triomphe from our bedroom. The bedroom was larger than I expected it to be with a comfortable bed, plasma TV, mini bar, bathroom with bath and separate shower cubicle and very clean and tidy throughout. We also got a complimentary bottle of Champagne. It wasn't in the room on arrival but without prompting they brought it up to our room later that day and it was there for us to enjoy when we got back from our afternoon sight seeing. The Reception staff and bar staff were all friendly, helpful and cheerful. We had a full English breakfast included in our package. Unlike other hotels there is not a buffet but waiter service which will bring your choice to the table. Personally I preferred this as it was a more relaxing experience than battling for food with a crowd of people. There was plenty to eat. Choice of juice, choice of tea, coffee or hot chocolate (incidentally hot chocolate is to die for so give it a try!), big basket of pastries with jams. The cooked breakfast has sausage, egg any style, bacon, mushrooms and tomato and is cooked to order so hot and fresh. By the time you are finished you will be more than full enough to see through to lunchtime! The hotel itself is quite small so there are not any more amenities than necessary, so if you are looking for an all singing, all dancing type establishment then this isn't for you. However, if you like relaxed and peaceful surroundings with a boutique feel that is close to the Metro and has excellent accessability for all parts of Paris then this is a very good choice and you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: harry6palmer
Reviews.Content: Very clean room. Simple decor. Excellent air con. Quiet. Nice bright bathrooms. Comfy beds. Hotel staff very helpful. Directed me to an excellent fish restaurant called Chez Francis about 7 minutes walk away. For this price bracket the hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: jojo2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Radisson Champs Élysées. This was our 3rd stay at the property. Location, location, location. The check in process was smooth. The staff very friendly and always smiling. The room was in good condition, clean and, for Paris, quite large. Ample storage and the bed is very confortable. Our room was facing the street without a balcony to see the Arc-de-Triomphe. The windows are well soundproof. We had breakfast once at the hotel, but for 25EUR you can get a much better deal else where. When we checked ou, it was porring rain, and without asking, the clerk offered us umbrellas that we return when we came back to collect our bags. Very nice touch. Will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikcoopix
Reviews.Content: Great location. Lovely hotel. Nice & quiet for location. Room clean and tidy no serious refurbs needed. Staff very nice & HELPFUL. Just one thing they booked a taxi for the airport, the driver was mad. Too fast tried to tell him to slow down. Did not eat at hotel as seemed expensive. There was a deli a minute away and the Champs Elysees had plenty to choose from, so no need. Will not be disappointed, it not the Charles 5th but at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Always good”
Reviews.Author: WetAndCold
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the rooms are very nice. Most have standard American-style shower stalls, which is very nice if you don't like the French-hotel showers which don't have much of a partition from the bathroom. The rooms are quiet, even though it's in a busy part of town. The staff is always very helpful. Breakfast is a little pricey, but excellent- although the service at breakfast is inconsistent. If you need a snack, there is a market with a deli on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been so good.”
Reviews.Author: MikeMax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for our honeymoon. We paid a bit extra for a superior room with a view (and a free bottle of champagne). Like the rest of Paris, it was quite expensive. I couldn't seem to find any cheap deals on the web, so just booked through the Radisson website. We stayed there at the start of June 07. Upon arrival we were told that the water on our floor wasn't working. Consequently, we had to stay in another hotel for our first night. The only place on offer (apparently, as Paris was so busy!) was the Concorde La Fayette. This gets an average rating of just 2.5 on TripAdvisor. And it showed. Even though we were put in a Junior Suite, it was a large, run-down hotel in an inferior location (see the reviews for yourself). Needless to say, we were less than pleased. Especially as we were only there for 3 nights! When I finally spoke to the manager (of the Radisson), she offered us a free meal. But never once did they offer to upgrade us. In fact, when we finally got into our room, we had to ask a couple of times for our champagne. To be fair though, after this rather unfortunate incident, the hotel was generally fine. Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, with a nicely designed interior (although I still thought our room had a bit of a damp smell to it). Overall, I do think that our problem was probably a one-off. So I would still recommend this hotel. And the food was also very good. I just wish we'd realised that the drinks were free too... Finally, contrary to popular belief, we found the people in Paris to be very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderer1
Reviews.Content: I hesitated to review this hotel as I was there on "points", and sometimes it's not a fair assessment if you're not a paying customer. But I'll add my quick two cents. Location? Could NOT be much better. Of course, depending on what you're looking for. Near the fabulous designers, L'Arc de Triomphe was visible if I leaned out my window, Champs Elysees a 1 minute walk, restaurants, the Metro, a LOVELY store about a 30 second walk that had anything you could possibly need, an epicurean delight. This was my 4th trip to Paris, but each has been very different. This one was luxurious. If you're looking for more flavor/charm/character...the Champs Elysees might not be the area for you. Room was beautiful. Wooden floors and built ins, gorgeous bathroom. I had two rooms (traveling with teens) that connected and both were nice. I was booked in a standard room, but I don't know if they might have upgraded me or not. The rooms were quite large with TONS of closet space. They look like the hotel's website. BUT...on arrival we had no air conditioning. I called down and was told it was inadvertently not turned on from downstairs, and that they then did so. I struggled for the next 2 nights wondering why it was still sweltering, but felt uncomfortable asking again because they SAID they'd corrrected it. Fortunately, it was COLD outside, so the rooms never got so that we couldn't stand it, but it was close. There was no opening the window to cool the room beause they were fabulously soundproofing. But, if you opened them, there is an underground garage entrance just outside the hotel and the horrid loud noise of cars exiting/entering and going over a metal plate is constant. The last day, I finally asked again, they said they'd call me back. In 5 minutes the air started and they never did call me back. We could hardly sleep so this was the only REALLY disappointing part. We ate the full breakfast there both days, and it was reasonably priced compared to others. And it was VERY good. The service was polite at the small restaurant/bar...as well as the front desk. I got a tiny bit of attitude from the concierge when I asked if they could check when the Paris Opera (Garnier) held tours in English. My daughter is a huge fan and, though we speak a bit of French, knew we'd get a lot more out of the tour in English. But online searches gave conflicting information and it was THE reason we decided to stop in Paris again. "Well, I've never done anything like that...but I guess I'll make the call". Of course I tipped him, and ... in typical American fashion overtipped. But he still must have felt it was something he shouldn't have to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FrequenttravelerSFCA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven night stay at the Radisson Paris. It was my wife's first time to Paris, although I have been several times and have stayed in properties ranging from very small boutique hotels to the Meurice. Overall, the Radisson delivered on the Parisian experience. The location is fantastic, located in the 8th district just off the Champs Elysees. Very good restaurants, cafes, and shopping are very close by, and the George V metro stop is less than 5 mins walk. Next door is a sort of drugstore that also sells books, pastries, sundries and drinks (incl spirits) which is very convenient. Breakfast (we had the continental each morning) was very good. The service was excellent, both at the concierge and in the restaurant. The staff speaks excellent English and are very helpful, although for food recommendations, we would recommend a Zagat or Michelin guide for the true foodie in Paris. Rooms were clean, decorated with a modern flair, and roomy (~200 sq feet) for Parisian standards. Bed and linens were very comfortable. In room bar and safe provided. Our room had a limited view of the street, although we have been told Eiffel Tower views are available. The only complaints we would have would be the overall cleanliness of the bathrooms. The bathrooms themselves are of a good size - however, the sink is of a unique shape, and like previous reviewers have commented, difficult to keep clean. Likewise, we felt the shower could have been somewhat cleaner. Otherwise, an overall excellent stay, with a very friendly and helpful staff. Value for money is debatable (we paid 350 euros ~ 500 USD) but this just seems to be Europe nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Just short of the mark”
Reviews.Author: mrsmonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with the Romance package for our wedding anniversary. Check in was great and the staff at the front desk were courteous and efficient at all times. There were however just a few things which stopped this hotel from being as good as it could be. Simple things like providing luxury toiletries only on the first day left us feeling dissatisfied especially as the rate is the same for each day. Breakfast was disorganised and despite the numerous staff you needed to ask for everything which made it a bit of an ordeal rather than a pleasure. Housekeeping was really only focussed on making the bed and providing clean towels, the room itself was really not cleaned. We did enjoy our stay , the room and bathroom were excellent and the location was terrific but I wouldn't return to this hotel. This is our 3rd stay in Paris and the only time we have really felt just a bit let down by a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: IvyNewcastleuponTyne
Reviews.Content: I am also torn on my feelings about the Radisson Clamps Elysees. The staff were very helpful and extremely cheerful and the hotel is in an excellent location and very well maintained. However, I was disappointed with certain aspects. Although I had requested a no smoking room I was given the key to a smoking room but when explained were moved without any problem to a no smoking room. I had booked a deluxe room but while the room was ok, albeit a bit small, I did not feel that it was 'deluxe'. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but perhaps this is normal for Paris. The funky grey sink had limescale deposit in and did not appear to be very hygenic. We had paid for a package to include champagne on arrival (had to ask for it and did not arrive until late afternoon and was very poor quality). The package also included full English breakfast which I chose not to have and opted for the cheaper breakfast but was then told that I could not have the basket of croissants/bread buns as it was not included in the package?! I left the breakfast table hungry. Would I stay there again - no. I think the hotel is overpriced and we paid for the 'Radisson' name and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FrancophileAustralia
Reviews.Content: Booked the Radisson based on the good reviews posted on this website. We reserved a room with a view on the top floor and were not disappointed. It had a wonderful picture postcard view of the Arc de Triomphe. Room was a good size and we loved the contemporary furniture and the timber floors which are much cleaner and healthier than carpet. Definitely well worth the price. It is also in a great, safe location with easy access to restaurants, the Champ Elysee and the Metro. While Ave Marceau is reasonably busy, the rooms were extremely quiet as a result of the double glazed windows. Staff were always very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Triciak40
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Paris was incredible thanks to our stay at the Radisson Champs Elysees! The staff was incredible, our rooms where phenomenal and our view as to die for! A MUST for anyone traveling to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globus-Globi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this hotel. We had two rooms with a connecting door so that the two kids had their own room. The hotel is suberbly located next door to the Arc de Triomphe and a metro station. We can highly recommend this hotel. The hotel is 100% noise proof, has a stylish interior and friendly staff. The breakfest is very tasty. The rooms are rather small but even five star hotels like the Intercontinental have similar size rooms. The hotel has no restaurant. As you stay in the middle of Paris, this does not matter. Nevertheless, there is a room service if you really do not want try one of the numerous restaurants in the surrounding. The mattresses are excellent and the bath room is also clean and nice. Bottom line: We will go again and can recommend the place. Not cheap, but worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jenski
Reviews.Content: Having looked at the last review it appears that not all the room facilities are the same we didnt have a coffee machine and we didnt get nice cakes! Also our room stunk of cigrarettes we did ask for the room to be sprayed and we even tried to change rooms however being easter the rooms were full! Now aside the negatives the location is great and I believe thats what you truly pay for. The service in the hotel apart from not getting cakes! is good and we got everything we asked for. So cant fault them there. The car park is crazy and they were not helpful. i will also say that Paris is vvvv expensive and prices for everything have massively inflated on average we were paying 6- 8 euros for a bottle of beer bit steep when we half that at home. However I love the place and wwould reccomend a visit to Budha bar not cheap but great place

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: foxylady2007
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Paris, and after reading the reviews on tripadvisor we choose this hotel - and it was GREAT! Staff was great, location, cleaning, food...everything. I canot find a minus.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: LadylovesNY
Reviews.Content: Cannot praise this hotel enough, lovely staff, lovely setting! So central, the food was great, would really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - GREAT service!”
Reviews.Author: cjc100uk
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a conference meeting. However the room suggested for the meeting was far too small. They solved this problem very quickly and provided an alternative (just across the street) which was more than adequate. The hotel is compact but very comfortable and stylish. Overall the stay was great, lovely hotel and excellent service all round. The staff couldn't do enough to help and the Concierge was fanstastic!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room and super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: manhattan1
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Paris within a year. Back in May I stayed at the Prince de Galles on George V in the 8th. Being I love the area, but couldn't afford the Prince for a full week I tried my luck at the Radisson SAS Champs Elysees, and soooo glad I did! It feels more like a boutique hotel, the thing I loved most about it was that the room had hard wood floors, so no icky odor! Bed was extremely comfortable and clean. The bath was to die for! Full tub, separate shower and fantastic modern sink. Of course, in European fashion, the room was small, but big deal, face it folks, MOST of the rooms outside the U.S. are smaller than we're used to (except Manhattan, where I live). The staff was so incredibly friendly. I ate at the restaurant one night, it was ok, I'm more of a brasserie girl when I'm in Paris, but the staff was so sweet I just wanted to "hang" with them one night in the hotel. Had a glass of wine every night in the lobby "library" bar. And I must say, the croque monsier there was one of the best I've ever had in my life! I will absolutely stay there again, without any hesitation. The price is (dare I say) cheap considering what you're getting. And yes, so close to everything....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Troylee123
Reviews.Content: Hotel just off the Arc de Triomphe and around the corner from the Champs Elysees. Very pleasant modern room. Staff on front Desk very helpful and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Albo1960
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all of the Trip Advisor reviewers for this hotel - we completely agree with all of the positive ones. My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in early December. As recommended by this site we asked for room 702 - a lovely, comfortable, modern room with a balcony and a great view of the Arc de Triomphe - only minutes away. One piece of advice - get off the No. 1 line at George V station - although not as near on the map as Charles de Gaulle l'Etoille (Arc de Triomphe), it is quicker to get in and out of the station at George V because the subways are so extensive at Charles de Gaulle l'Etoille and there's many more people there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in Paris 75008”
Reviews.Author: redshoes2
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in a safe location with great views of the Arc di Triomphe. Staff are very polite and helpfull also all very well versed in hotel etiquette. I would highly recommend this hotel to others and would most definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: reviewmaster
Reviews.Content: The Radisson SAS on Avenue Marceau, Champs-Elysees was great. An excellent location - walking out of the door to see the Arc de Triomph right there. The rooms were lovely - loads of storage and a gorgeous bathroom with separate shower and bath. The bedroom was clean, trendy - everything you would need. The service was excellent - the concierge was particularly - booked us restaurants, gave us maps with directions for restaurants. I would definately recommend this hotel and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Spinalonga
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weekend from Paris. Radisson SAS hotel is second to none if you're looking for a hotel near Champs. It is strategically located just off Champs Elysees so you don't get all the noise and crowd, yet it's less than a minute walk from the main street. The hotel is recently renevated so everything feels/smells fresh. It's a very cosy hotel with 50 or so rooms. Staff are very helpful and will do everything they can to make your stay pleasent. Recommended to parents coming with children. Because of the size of the hotel, you really feel that the staff are taking care of you. This is rated as a 3 star hotel in Tripadvisor but would give it a 4 star without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: CockneyBrum
Reviews.Content: Despite arriving dishevelled after an overnight rail journey from Rome, the staff were fantastic and did not turn their noses up at us! We were carrying some items in a cooler bag, which the concierge offered to place in the hotel fridge to keep them cool. Great service from start to finish. We were lucky enough to get upgraded to the only suite at the hotel, which has a lovely roof terrace offering partial views of the Arc de Triumph. Thank you Radisson Goldpoints! The suite was very spacious with free wireless internet, a deluxe jacuzzi, complimentary slippers & dressing gowns, and chocolate on our pillows before we turned in the for the night. The location of the hotel is excellent. You are close to the Metro and the pickup point for the city tour bus. This is a fantastic romantic hotel with superb staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: 123rep123
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel. Would go back again. High marks for each of the following: Location: Extremely convenient. A few blocks from the main Metro line that goes directly to the Louvre and other major attractions and provides transfers to all other lines. A block from the Champs-Elysees, which has numerous shopping and eating options at all price levels. Drug/foodstore at the corner is open until 2am. Close to ritzy shopping if that's important. Very pleasant 10-15 walk to the river and the Bateaux Mouche. Room: As with most European rooms, a bit on the small side. But room is clean and modern, a bit like a W hotel. Bed was comfortable and a true king, not two singles put together. We were on a non-smoking floor and did not have any issues with smelling smoke. Bathroom was good-sized, plenty of room. No shower curtain/door, so just need to be careful about spraying water. Small refrigerator where we stored water, milk, juice, fruits. No issue with noise, though we did face the inside courtyard. Service and Amenities: Concierge/front desk was uniformly pleasant and helpful with providing directions, suggestions and reservations for dinner (definitely try Chez Henri for the French brasserie experience, excellent food and gracious service). There is one computer in the lobby/lounge area with free internet access. Did not try to food. Preferred to grab food from a pastry shop or to buy some cereal/fruits at a nearby grocery and eat in our room. Conclusion: Would highly recommend to anyone. Comparable to high quality hotels here in the US. Westin/W in particular comes to mind.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and central plus proper fire safety!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night, on their "room with a view package". I requested top floor, and got room 702, which I think has the biggest balcony (the other balconies all looked smaller - big enough to stand on and enjoy the view, but my balcony had seats on it!). Ask for 702, but if it's not available the other balconies looked fine to me and I'd have been happy with a different room. Reception staff are superb, all seem to speak English, and it was a nice friendly and professional welcome. Location is great, although be aware that it's on a busy road, so on a hot night I kept the windows shut and the air conditioning on. The latter was adequate, although not bone-chilling. There was a wired-in smoke detector in the room, and in the halls, and proper fire exits! This is the main reason I booked there, because too many Paris hotels don't take fire safety seriously. Although it's a small hotel, there were two fire exits close to me, and on a quick look both seemed to be in order (ie the door opened, no obstructions, nothing stored there). Flat screen tv had the main channels you would expect, including BBC World for English language news. Bathroom was brilliantly fitted out and they were generous with the towels. There is a rather nice panelled hallway, and if you close the door between it and the bedroom, there is just the light from the frosted glass door of the bathroom, it forms a relaxing place to just sit for a bit. That probably makes no sense, but try it if you stay there. The room and bathroom were very clean indeed, the wooden floor having been mopped. There is a good deal of lighting, in all sorts of different configurations, which I liked - I hate it when you can't get some decent bright light to read, or can't get a nice dim light for relaxing in. The views are splendid - of the Arc de Triomph in one direction, and you can see the top third of the Eifel Tower in the other direction, which looks nice at night when it's lit up. If you stay on a lower floor, I think you probably won't get to see as much or anything of the Eifel Tower though. A few negatives. Although the bathroom and hallway are lovely, I found the room itself a bit ugly. The curtains were a rather drab blue, and there was some rather nasty modern art on the walls. All harmless enough, and you don't visit Paris to sit in your hotel room all day looking at the curtains. Bed was okay but slightly softer than I like. Breakfast was okay but slightly disappointing, in terms of both quality and quantity for the price. I've had better in Paris hotels, but also worse - I think I'd just expected slightly better. I think I paid just over 300 Euros for the night, can't remember the precise amount, and I thought it was good value for money. The package included a bottle of champagne, which was on ice and yummy. I'd stay there again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Radisson SAS Champs Elysees - Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: susca
Reviews.Content: WONDERFUL HOTEL! Our family of ten spent two nights at this Radisson Hotel in Paris in June 2006 and it lived up to the good reviews by others. We had one family with 4 members (2 children) with only one bed in the room. Hotel staff went above and beyond the call of duty to fit a rollaway into the room which was small, but large by Paris standards. We have stayed at other Paris hotels which were a lot more expensive, but not as nice as this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful in every way. In fact, I left a sandal in the room and contacted the hotel after returning home. I emailed them about two weeks later and they searched diligently and finally found it. They actually called me to make arrangements to mail the sandal back to me. The rooms were very nice and modern, looking like they had been recently updated. They also were air conditioned which was a necessity the weekend we were in Paris as it was extremely hot. The location was perfect for walking to all of the sites or catching the underground. I would make this hotel my hotel of choice for my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location - a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Radisson SAS Hotel Champs Elysees is a great hotel! If it is your first visit to Paris, the Champs Elysees is a wonderful location! The hotel is clean, the staff is very friendly and the decor is very modern and minimalist - which is very nice since the rooms are so small! I don't mind small rooms since most of our time was spent out and about, however I think it's a little pricey. The room itself was a pretty good value because of the location and hight quality of the hotel, but everything else adds up (I had a hot chocolate at the bar that was $10)! The Radisson SAS Hotel Champs Elysees is a first class hotel. It's 1 block from the Arc and very close to the metro station. Since I'm now more familiar with the city, I will most likely stay a little further from Champs Elysees and get a little more room for my money. But like I said, it's a good, boutique hotel for your first visit to Paris, or if you like staying in the heart of the tourist area! It's very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: posterguru
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many of the hotels in Paris as business has us there often from the US. This was our first time at the Radisson, and we will certainly use them again. The rooms were ample size, clean and well appointed. The staff was very helpful and polite. Bathroom was spotless. The only negative I would give would be on the quality of the bed, a bit of a let down and definatly not a place to cut corners. But for the money I can deal with it...

Reviews.Title: “Ravishing Radisson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the SAS Radisson on the Avenue Marceau for 4 nights in early May. Overall this is an excellent boutique hotel, it has a wonderful location very close to the Champs Elysees and Metro which makes it very easy to get around. We paid a little extra, Eur 340 per night in order to secure a room with a view of the Arc De Triomphe and it was well worth the extra expense. The room was comfortable with a large bathroom and the rate included a full English Breakfast each morning for two. The staff were helpful and very pleasant at all times, all in all a thumbs up for the Radisson, which contributed to a magical stay in Paris, we would return to this hotel without hesitation and we are already looking forward to doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry... I was disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: nephalion
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel over Easter on a weekend getaway to Paris. As a romantic I paid the extra to get a room with a guaranteed view of Arc de Triomphe and a bottle of champagne on arrival. I’m torn on this hotel. The employees are lovely, helpful, friendly and forgiving of Englishmen that don’t speak French. On Easter Sunday they even delivered an Easter Egg. A lovely touch. The rooms look nice too. They are funky modern affairs… I said I was torn… The downsides are… The room was small, we stayed in 203, there is just enough room for the furniture and not enough room for the furniture if you want to open the French doors leading to the balcony with that view of the Arc de Triomphe.
