Don’t get too excited, the balcony is less than a metre wide and the only way you see the Arc is by stepping out onto it. Then again you could just step outside the hotel and get a better view… The champagne (actually… methode champenoise) was not exactly quality either. The funky bathroom has a door frame that is coming away from the wall, not major, but a nice dirt trap that should be fixed. The shower has a waterproof (I hope…) light directly above the shower head. I say I hope it is waterproof because the shower head needs replacing a water shoots at force into the light and the ceiling! The basin is funky, not practical though and the limescale deposit that has been allowed to build up is a little unforgivable. Finally the in-room safe was not, on account of how it did not work. When I pointed this out I was told it would be fixed, it was not… nor where we offered an alternate room, then this was one of the better rooms… In all my reviews I say, the bottom line is this, would I stay there again? The answer is simple… No. I suspect there are far better hotels in Paris than this one. And don’t expect that famous Radisson promise to get you out of jail either. I was not satisfied and I still had to pay full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Fabulous Location..”
Reviews.Author: SumFin
Reviews.Content: We went here for our honeymoon and it was wonderful! The rooms were lovely and the bathrooms were fab! Whever we went out - no matter how long for - the beds were always made when we came back. The mini bar was well stocked and it had a flat screen TV in the room. The air conditioning was lovely also! We didn't eat there but due to its amazing location, there is plenty of places for you to go. It is a few steps to the Arc de triomph and the Champs Elysees, which is brillaint as the shops on the Champs Elysees don't seem to ever close!! When we got there the very helpful concierge booked us in to the most AMAZING restaurant I have ever been to called 'Le Chiberta' which is a few minutes away. If your staying here you MUST go to it!!! It was about 140 euros for two people two courses but worth every penny. We got a good deal through expedia.co.uk as it is very expensive there. Then again everything in Paris is ridiculously expensive - and i thought London was expensive! You can jump on the double decker bus from the Arc de Triomph which takes you around all the major sites - a great way to see Paris. The only one thing i would say is that i arranged through the hotel to have a "Limo" to pick us up from the Gare du Nord. It certainly WASN'T a limo and it cost 125 euros!!! The most expensive taxi ride EVER!!!!! There are millions of taxis waiting outside the station when you arrive and it is easy as pie to flag one down on the Champs Elysees when your leaving. This taxi ride cost about 15 euros. All in all a wonderful hotel - it really made our trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel, brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: Xsempre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located conveniently very close to the Arc de Triomphe. This means you can get very quickly to the other parts of the city (the metro station "CDG/etoille" is only a 2 minute walk away: you have direct lines to: the Eifel Tower, Grande Arche/La défense, the Louvre, ... However, it's located in a rather quiet and very clean street. It's next to the busy shopping street Champs-Elysees, yet it's not crowded or overloaded with traffic. We had a room on the top floor (703). The room is not too big, but it is very clean and modern. It's also very cosy. The bathroom likewise: it's a pleasure to fresh yourself up in such a nice room. Our room had a (small) balcony with a good view on the Arc de Triomphe, and you could also see the top of the Eifel Tower (very nice at night time). We had the "room-with-a-view" package. This also included a bottle of champagne upon arrival and a continental breakfast. The staff is very friendly and helpfull: we arrived early (9am), and our room was not ready (check-in is at 2pm), but we could leave our suitcases at the luggage room. We came to rest at the hotel at 5pm for half an hour, but when we arrived back at 9pm: the beds were already made again, with complementary chocolates on the pillows (something the Mrs. always appreciates ;-)). Airconditioning is good. The rooms are isolated very good: you hear virtualy nothing, so you can get a good night's sleep. The only "downside" was the breakfast. Normally it costs 22 euro, but for this you get only: coffee or tea, fruit juice, some small breads and a choice in jelly/jams. For this kind of money, I think you should get an all-you-can-eat buffet breakfast with a variety of things to eat with your bread. It was included in our package: otherwise I would never have taken it: too expensive, too little... But don't let this spoil the rest: it's a fantastic hotel! Rather expensive, but you get what you pay for! Would definitely stay there again and/or recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “100% Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: B.G._Chicago
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel in mid-August 2005 for four nights (I'm a little delayed in writing my review). The location is absolutely wonderful. When we traveled to Paris in the past we received somewhat of a frosty reception from our hotel, but the staff at the Radisson went above and beyond being friendly. They booked our train reservation to London for us, finding an incredible deal, gave us suggestions for many delicious restaurants on the Champs to try, and the concierge even had a drink with us one evening (after work of course). :) The room was very posh and modern, with flat screen tvs and gorgeous furniture. Although it's a little smaller than traditional American hotel rooms, it never felt tiny. There's only about eight rooms per floor, which makes it feel even more quaint. The location of the hotel is fantastic - the Champs is one street over. My mother and I never felt nervous walking home at night, even after a few glasses of wine on the Champs. Overall, this is a fantastic hotel that I would gladly return to.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff & Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 1 week spent into Paris. Nothing began well, as all our luggages have been lost by our carrier and it was for me so important to get them because they did contain my medicine treatment. So I get very seriously stressed until we arrived into this heaven of peace. As soon we get there, everything was under controlled, Thomas and Renald were more than gentle and helpful, they have taken all our needs into consideration, taking notes about the details from our flights, etc.... They were so amazing! We spent with our little family very happy holidays, everything was great as I can get my medicine delivered daily, our luggages were finally delivered in New York but for us the more important was the extremely high standard of service reached by this hotel. Thank you guys, we do love you, and will come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a wonderful 3 night break at the Radisson SAS Hotel. All I can say is that our stay was perfect in every way, the hotel staff were extremely courteous and helpful, our hotel room was on the 7th floor with wonderful views of both the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower, the hotel was extremely clean - rooms even cleaned twice daily! Paris was absolutely beautiful and the people could not have been more friendly. We travelled to Paris on Eurostar from Waterloo which was also extremely good and I would recommend upgrading to Leisure Select. I would travel via Eurostar again and when we return to Paris I would definately stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: ottawaon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson SAS in the Champs Elysees area and were very pleased with our stay. The hotel is a boutique hotel with approx. 50 rooms. The hotel is very well kept and modern. The rooms are very nice and completely sound proof and include modern amenities such as Plasma TV, mohagany cabinetry and modern bathrooms with deep tubs. Our room was non smoking on the second floor and had a nice little balcony looking over L'Arc de Triomphe. The standard rooms are a little on the small size and could use more storage space for suitcases. There are plenty of nice restaurants in the area and the concierge was very friendly and helpful in helping us find restaurants, wine shops, pastry shops etc. We ate one night in the hotel and the food was ok. Nice presentation but not overly tasty and a little pricey. For breakfast, I recommend the Brioche Dore. It's a restaurant chain (lots of them on Champs Elysees) and on weekends you can get coffee, juice and 2 croissants for around 5 Euro. At the hotel, a cup of coffee was 5 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Watch out. The hotel is very nice and despite being on a busy road has good sound insulation. However you really do run the risk of being bumped. Just like another reviewer on this site I booked a two night stay over a month in advance abd was told, on arrival, that there were no room for me at the inn (a similar excuse of clients being ill etc). They put us in the napoleon for one night. The napoleon was ok but not up the Radisson's standards. Anyway our w/e was very much inconvenienced and I insisted on a discount, which I got and made up for it, at least to some extent - but I would have preferred to pay full rate and stay at the radisson. A tip. Radisson have a policy - if you dont like what they give you and they dont correct it - you dont pay. I didn't insist on it (I did get a discount) but am sure that I could have. Would I go again? - yes - but in future I will be calling in advance to make sure they dont mess me about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Champs Elisses for 4 nights to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We loved everything about this hotel!! The staff was awesome. They all speak English and they went out of their way to help us with directions, tours, reservations, etc. Without even asking, we got upgraded to a room with a balcony, which overlooked the Arc de Triumph. - The room was very clean and spacious by European standards. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, which has excellent food, but it was expensive. - The location couldn't be better. It's 1/2 block walk to the Arc of Triumph, 1 block away from the Champs Elysees, where you find bistros, boutiques, restaurants and the famous Lido. It's also just 1 block to the Charles De Gaulle Metro. We took the metro everywhere. Also, the "Hop on Hop off" double-decker bus (great way to see Paris), stops at Charles de Gaulle. - This hotel is a great alternative to the Marriott, which is more expensive and it's just 4 blocks away. Overall we give the Radisson two thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,central location”
Reviews.Author: MELSY
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed for a short break for new Year. The hotel was well located & the room was clean & well furnished-although slightly on the small side. There was an excellent restaurant located close by together with the Publics drugstore which was amazing. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Radisson. Small hotel in a great location - it's nice and quiet & the staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed Bed & B/fast (de-lish!)

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Blu Hotel Champs Elysees, Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 78bis Avenue Marceau (80 Arr), 75008 Paris, France (Formerly Radisson SAS)
